tr.td:
eHN Health Professional
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference

a.title: An identifier of the health professional that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National health professional ID. Multiple identifiers could be provided.

a.title: Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.

description.value: eHN Dataset for identification of the health professional

definition.value: eHN Dataset for identification of the health professional
An identifier of the health professional that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National health professional ID. Multiple identifiers could be provided.
Structured name of the HP. The structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname.
Role or occupation of the health professional. Multiple roles could be provided (medical doctor; nursing professional; pharmacist).
The healthcare provider organisation the health professional is associated with.

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which the health professional is the preferred contact.
eHN Dataset for identification of the health professional
An identifier of the health professional that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National health professional ID. Multiple identifiers could be provided.
Structured name of the HP. The structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname.
Role or occupation of the health professional. Multiple roles could be provided (medical doctor; nursing professional; pharmacist).
The healthcare provider organisation the health professional is associated with.

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which the health professional is the preferred contact.
